alert.note: Alert for Colorado; Jackson; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:31PM CDT until May 16 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. Sandy Creek near Cordele affecting Jackson, Wharton and Colorado Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandy Creek...including Cordele...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Speaks, Morales, Strane Park... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandy Creek near Cordele. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with the creek close to 200 yards wide at FM 710 in the vicinity of the gage. Secondary roads are cut off and bridges near the creek flood and are dangerous. Livestock are cut off and potentially drowned. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 07/06/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Sandy Creek Cordele 18.0 16.5 Sun 7 am CDT 18.3 17.4 15.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
